Arthropoda.description: Includes insects, spiders, crustaceans, and other jointed-legged animals

Chordata.description: Includes vertebrates (mammals, birds, fish, reptiles, amphibians) and some invertebrates

Mollusca.description: Includes snails, clams, squids, and octopuses

Annelida.description: Includes earthworms, leeches, and marine worms

Cnidaria.description: Includes jellyfish, corals, and sea anemones

Echinodermata.description: Includes starfish, sea urchins, and sea cucumbers

Nematoda.description: Includes many parasitic and free-living worms

Porifera.description: Simple aquatic animals with porous bodies

Hemichordata.description: Marine worms with some chordate characteristics

Ascomycota.description: Largest phylum of fungi, including yeasts and molds

Proteobacteria.description: Large group of gram-negative bacteria including many pathogens

Firmicutes.description: Group of bacteria including many beneficial gut bacteria

Bacteroidota.description: Group of bacteria important in human gut microbiome

Actinobacteriota.description: Group of bacteria including many soil bacteria and antibiotic producers

Chlorophyta.description: Photosynthetic algae found in freshwater and marine environments

Rhodophyta.description: Marine algae often found in deeper waters

Tracheophyta.description: Plants with vascular tissue, including ferns and seed plants

Bryophyta.description: Small, non-vascular plants that grow in damp environments

Marchantiophyta.description: Simple, non-vascular plants similar to mosses

Ciliophora.description: Single-celled organisms with hair-like cilia for movement

Foraminifera.description: Single-celled organisms with calcium carbonate shells

Ochrophyta.description: Includes kelp and other large marine algae

Oomycota.description: Fungus-like organisms that cause plant diseases

Chytridiomycota.description: Simple fungi that can cause amphibian diseases

Glomeromycota.description: Fungi that form symbiotic relationships with plant roots

Mucoromycota.description: Fungi including bread molds and some pathogens

Thermoproteota.description: Heat-loving archaea found in extreme environments

Halobacteriota.description: Salt-loving archaea found in hypersaline environments

Planctomycetota.description: Bacteria with unique cell structure and metabolism

Verrucomicrobiota.description: Bacteria found in soil and aquatic environments

Myxococcota.description: Bacteria that form fruiting bodies and move in swarms

Chaetognatha.description: Small marine predators with transparent bodies

Ctenophora.description: Marine animals with rows of cilia

Cycliophora.description: Tiny marine animals found on lobster mouthparts

Dicyemida.description: Parasitic animals found in cephalopod kidneys

Gnathostomulida.description: Small marine worms with complex jaws

Loricifera.description: Microscopic marine animals with protective lorica

Placozoa.description: Simple marine animals with few cell types

Sipuncula.description: Marine worms that can retract into peanut shape

Tardigrada.description: Microscopic animals known for extreme survival

Amoebozoa.description: Single-celled organisms that move using pseudopodia

Calcitarcha.description: Microscopic organisms with calcium carbonate shells

Choanozoa.description: Single-celled organisms with a collar of microvilli

Euglenozoa.description: Single-celled organisms with flagella, including some photosynthetic species

Loukozoa.description: Single-celled organisms with a ventral groove

Metamonada.description: Anaerobic single-celled organisms, often found in animal guts

Microsporidia.description: Parasitic single-celled organisms that infect animals

Mycetozoa.description: Organisms that can exist as single cells or form multicellular structures

Sarcomastigophora.description: Single-celled organisms that move using flagella or pseudopodia

Sulcozoa.description: Single-celled organisms with a ventral groove

Artverviricota.description: Group of viruses including some that infect bacteria

Cossaviricota.description: Group of viruses including some that infect animals

Cressdnaviricota.description: Group of viruses with circular single-stranded DNA

Dividoviricota.description: Group of viruses that infect bacteria

Duplornaviricota.description: Group of viruses with double-stranded RNA genomes

Hofneiviricota.description: Group of viruses that infect archaea

Kitrinoviricota.description: Group of viruses including some that infect plants

Lenarviricota.description: Group of viruses that infect fungi and plants

Negarnaviricota.description: Group of viruses with negative-sense RNA genomes

Nucleocytoviricota.description: Group of large DNA viruses that infect eukaryotes

Peploviricota.description: Group of viruses with an outer envelope

Phixviricota.description: Group of viruses that infect bacteria

Pisuviricota.description: Group of viruses with positive-sense RNA genomes

Preplasmiviricota.description: Group of viruses that infect bacteria

Saleviricota.description: Group of viruses that infect archaea

Taleaviricota.description: Group of viruses that infect bacteria

Uroviricota.description: Group of viruses that infect bacteria

Altiarchaeota.description: Archaea found in deep subsurface environments

Asgardarchaeota.description: Archaea that may be ancestors of eukaryotes

Hadarchaeota.description: Archaea found in deep subsurface environments

Iainarchaeota.description: Archaea found in deep subsurface environments

Micrarchaeota.description: Small archaea found in various environments

Nanoarchaeota.description: Very small archaea that live on other archaea

Nanohaloarchaeota.description: Small archaea found in hypersaline environments

Thermoplasmatota.description: Acid-loving archaea found in hot springs

Abyssubacteria.description: Bacteria found in deep sea environments

Aquificota.description: Heat-loving bacteria found in hot springs

Atribacterota.description: Group of bacteria found in various environments

Bipolaricaulota.description: Group of bacteria with bipolar growth

Caldisericota.description: Heat-loving bacteria found in hot springs

Calditrichota.description: Heat-loving bacteria found in hot springs

Campylobacterota.description: Group of bacteria including some pathogens

Chlamydiota.description: Group of bacteria including some pathogens

Chrysiogenota.description: Group of bacteria that can reduce arsenic

Cloacimonadota.description: Group of bacteria found in anaerobic environments

Coprothermobacterota.description: Heat-loving bacteria found in hot springs

Cryptophyta.description: Group of algae with complex chloroplasts

Deferribacterota.description: Group of bacteria that can reduce iron

Dependentiae.description: Group of bacteria that depend on other organisms

Dictyoglomota.description: Heat-loving bacteria found in hot springs

Elusimicrobiota.description: Group of bacteria found in termite guts

Fermentibacterota.description: Group of bacteria involved in fermentation

Fibrobacterota.description: Group of bacteria found in animal guts

Fusobacteriota.description: Group of bacteria including some pathogens

Gemmatimonadota.description: Group of bacteria found in soil

Hydrogenedentota.description: Group of bacteria that can use hydrogen

Latescibacterota.description: Group of bacteria found in various environments

Methylomirabilota.description: Group of bacteria that can oxidize methane

Neocallimastigomycota.description: Anaerobic fungi found in animal guts

Nitrospinota.description: Group of bacteria involved in nitrogen cycling

Nitrospinota_B.description: Subgroup of bacteria involved in nitrogen cycling

Nitrospirota_A.description: Subgroup of bacteria involved in nitrogen cycling

Omnitrophota.description: Group of bacteria found in various environments

Patescibacteria.description: Group of small bacteria with reduced genomes

Poribacteria.description: Group of bacteria found in marine sponges

Sanchytriomycota.description: Group of fungi found in marine environments

Sumerlaeota.description: Group of bacteria found in various environments

Synergistota.description: Group of bacteria found in animal guts

Tectomicrobia.description: Group of bacteria found in marine sponges

Thermotogota.description: Heat-loving bacteria found in hot springs

Zoopagomycota.description: Group of fungi that parasitize animals

Zygomycota.description: Group of fungi including bread molds

Pieris rapae.description: Common butterfly also known as cabbage white

Pararge aegeria.description: Woodland butterfly with distinctive wing patterns

Aglais io.description: Butterfly with eye-like patterns on wings
